Utterance: Hi, it's good to see you again! How have you been since our last session?
Hi, Ellie! I've been doing well, just keeping busy with school and work.
That's great to hear! Last time, we talked about your studies and how you're feeling about your psychology major. Have you thought any more about that?
Yeah, I have. I’m still unsure if I want to pursue sports psychology. I’m kind of feeling lost, to be honest.
It’s completely normal to feel that way, especially when you’re nearing graduation. What do you think is causing that uncertainty?
I guess I’m worried about finding a job in that field. And I’m not sure if it’s really what I want anymore.
That makes sense. The pressure to find a career path can be overwhelming. Have you thought about exploring other areas of psychology or related fields?
I’ve considered counseling or maybe even teaching. I like the idea of helping people directly.
Those are both excellent options. It might be helpful to explore what aspects of psychology resonate with you the most. What do you enjoy about counseling or teaching?
I think I like the idea of making a difference in someone’s life. Like, being there for someone when they need support.
That’s a wonderful motivation. Have you had any experiences, either personally or through your studies, that have reinforced that desire to help others?
Well, I’ve been volunteering at a local community center. It’s been really fulfilling to see the impact we can have on people.
That sounds like a rewarding experience! What have you learned from that volunteer work?
I’ve learned that everyone has their struggles, and sometimes just listening can help a lot. It feels good to be that person for someone.
Listening is such a valuable skill. How do you feel about your listening skills? Do you think they could help you in a future career?
I think I’m a pretty good listener. I try to be present and really understand what people are saying.
That’s a great quality to have. In our last session, you mentioned wanting to study more and exercise more. Have you made any progress on those goals?
I’ve been trying to set aside time to study, but it’s hard with my schedule. I haven’t really exercised though.
It can be tough to balance everything. What do you think is holding you back from exercising?
I think I just feel too tired after work and school. It’s hard to find the motivation.
That’s understandable. Sometimes starting small can help. Have you thought about incorporating short exercises or activities into your day?
I haven’t really tried that. Maybe just a quick walk or something?
Exactly! Even a short walk can boost your mood and energy levels. Would you be willing to try that this week?
Yeah, I can try to do that. I think it would help me feel better overall.
That sounds like a great plan. How about your sleep? Last time you mentioned it wasn’t easy due to your schedule. How is that going?
It’s still a bit rough. I have to wake up early for work, so I don’t always get enough rest.
Sleep is so important for both your physical and mental health. Have you considered any strategies to improve your sleep quality?
I’ve thought about trying to stick to a routine, like going to bed and waking up at the same time.
That’s a solid approach! Consistency can really help regulate your sleep patterns. Would you like to set a goal around that for this week?
Sure, I can try to do that!
Great! Let's check in on that next session. Is there anything else you’d like to discuss today?
I think that covers it for now. I appreciate your help!
I’m glad to hear that! I look forward to hearing about your progress next time. Take care!
Thank you, Ellie! Bye!
Goodbye!
